node.accessibility_caption: Santa Barbara Microgreens Grow-room. 2 racks of microgreens 1 rack of seeding trays getting ready for light.

node.text:
This fall has been the longest #molting season ever! I bet you the ladies are so confused, they don't even know what to do. Get ready for winter? Hide some eggs and go broody? Is it summer yet? Wait a second... are we done with winter? Is it snowing? Raining again? Where's the sun? Continue slacking? #whatisgoingon ??? 😂🐓🐣🐔😁 
()()() Well at least we got some beautiful eggs. Hard to tell who laid them. I get so excited when I find eggs in the nests nowadays! "I got an egg... I got an egg!"
.
.
.
.
.
#backyardeggs #fresheggs #backyardpoultry #fresheggsdaily #eggenvy #happyhens #prettyeggs #organiceggs #colorfuleggs #eggsofinstagram #chicken #itswinter #organicfarming #eggsphotography #eggs #lewafarmontario #eggbasketcollective #homesteading #egglayers #proteins #eathealthyfood #yolks #freerangechickens #lovemychickens #smallscalefarming #winteregg

.

On our vibrant new tea packaging you'll meet Sobana Prakesh, a tea farmer and landowner with Tea Promoters India (TPI) 🌱 Because our tea is organically grown by farmers who are also the landowners, like Sobana, they are empowered to improve their lives and communities through fair trade. We think that’s the makings of a really good cup of tea 💚

📷: Sobana Prakesh, tea farmer and landowner with Tea Promoters India (TPI).

node.text:
Growing great garlic (fingers crossed 🤞)

Das erste Beet (ganz außen auf Feld 5) habe ich vor ca. drei Wochen mit Knoblauch bepflanzt. Normalerweise wird der schon Mitte Oktober gepflanzt - war also ein bisschen spät dran - aber ich bin zuversichtlich! 

Die Knoblauchzehen werden schon im Herbst gesteckt und überwintern unter einer (im Scheinwerferlicht ausgebrachten - wird aber auch einfach zu früh dunkel) Mulchschicht aus Rasenschnitt und Laub (Da hat @gemuesezeit_altluneberg gute Erfahrungen mit gemacht und diese mit uns geteilt, danke für euren Tipp 😊). Im Juni nächsten Jahres kann er dann geerntet werden. Ich hab mich dazu entschieden, drei verschiedene Sorten zu pflanzen - Messidor, Morado und Vallelado - mal sehen welche sich am besten entwickelt. 
Ich bin gespannt! 🤗

•••

#gemüsedeern #marketgardening #garlic #regenerativeagriculture #growinggarlic #marketgarden #gärtnernmachtglücklich #smallscalefarming

node.text:
Beautiful hyphae seen while digging in the soil next to our compost pile. Some may know what this is, others may not. Mycorrhizae is the symbiotic relationship between the mycelium of a fungus and the roots of a plant. The plant obtains minerals from the fungus, and the fungus obtains nutrients from the plant’s root. The hyphae shown is an extension of the fungus that can reach small soil spores that would otherwise be unavailable to the plant.🔍🔬🍄 Pretty cool, right?! We think so!
#familystylefarming #fungi #smallscalefarming #regenerativeagriculture #agriculture #virginiafarm #hempfarmers #soilhealth #livingsoil #zone7a #gardening #compost #soilscience #naturalfarming #knf

node.text:
Grass fed free range beef AKA her name was Bully - she won't be missed, hence her name 🤣 the fat on beef reared this way is next to nothing and the flavour knocks intensive grain fed supermarket beef out of the ball park 

So privileged to be in this position and rearing our own - such a joy being able to get back to my old ways of self sufficiency and buying less. Its a way of life . . . Live, hunt, forage, grow and rear - who needs mass consumerism 🤷‍♀️ support local or DIY

#winnerwinnerchickendinner #grassfed #organic #freerange #beef #onadifferentlevel #privilige #knowwhereyourfoodcomesfrom #livestock #smallholder #calfrearer #dairy #tasty #nomnom #farming #roastbeef #diy #smallscalefarming

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by samantha on November 28, 2020. Image may contain: food.

node.text:
Today is Shop Small Saturday, those are not just words, nor is it an announcement or and FYI, it’s a call to action! 
Crisis can always show one strengths and one’s weaknesses. A food and supply system that is not close to home was to us always obviously a weakness.With the current onslaught of crisis the message seems to be understood by everyone now. 
When times are difficult family might be too far away. And in the end all you really have is your neighbor and community. 

Add an extra helping of gratitude to those who stay in business, have pivoted, survived and are there for us  today.Please, find in your neighborhood a small shop, a farm stand, a farmers market, a craft or food artisan who might not even have a brick and mortar. 
SHOP as small and as local as you can today and every day. #shopsmall #localutahfirst #shopsmallbusiness #shoplocal #shoputah #smallfarmers #smallscalefarming

node.text:
Conference season has always been one of my favorite times of year, and by far the most important opportunity for building a vast and diverse network of farmers. It is the time when we connect with our peers, reinvigorate our passions for farming, and fill our heads full of inspiration and ideas for the coming season. 

We will miss hanging out with our friends this year. But we don’t have to miss the great speakers and content. Many of our conferences are continuing virtually this year. Now is your chance to check out events outside your region and expand your horizons.

Photos are mostly from previous years at EcoFarm Conference @eco.farm which will be online this January, also @sierraharvest @caff_famfarms @themarketgardeners @jeanmartinfortier and @theemeraldcup events. 

Posted by @megan.alluvial for @growingformarketmagazine

node.text:
Converting a shipping container into a climate controlled “garden lab” is not an easy feat. Especially when your on the north side of Chicago. 
🥶 🥬 🌱🌻🌞
Above is 4 of our 6 temperature and humidity sensors spread around the outside and inside of our grow lab. Constant monitoring alongside a network of switches, control a series of vents, heaters/ACs, dehumidifiers, and fans. ALL in an attempt to maintain an IDEAL grow temperature. No matter what the outside temperature is. 🥳 😁
🌱🌱🌱🌱🌱
MICROGREENS, though resilient, THRIVE at  65°-75° with 40-60% humidity. OUTSIDE this range is possible BUT QUALITY AND YIELD suffer greatly. Too cold, they become short and bland. Too hot, they become stringy and tough. While a humid day could wipe out your whole crop with rot. 🤢 Climate control is just ONE ☝️ of the many ways to grow QUALITY produce.
⚠️🌱⚠️🌱⚠️
To learn more about growing QUALITY microgreens. FOLLOW our page.
🌱🌱🌱🌱
Stay tuned our NORTH SHORE launch is soon! 🚀 
🌱
#gardenlab #chicagonorthshore #chicagosuburbs #farmersmarket #thinklocalfirst #shoplocal #farmtotable #gyof #growyourfood #knowyourfarmers #growyourgreens #gardenlab #microgreens🌱 #urbanfarming #indoorgardening #verticalfarming #chefconfetti #nosoil #squarefootgardening #smallscalefarming

node.text:
The sward ahead of the lambs. They grazed this last in September whilst still in the company of the ewes and when we were incredibly dry. I. At the time I thought I’d overdone it a touch with the and that we’d overgrazed sticking to our three day moves. 
70 days later and G tells me we’ve got a silage crop, and the little old lambs are requiring much hay to encourage things to solidify!

#smallscalefarming #grass #pasture #mobgrazing #justkeepmoving #bramerton #norfolkhorns #pasturefed #lamb #regenerativeagriculture #regenerativefarming #microfarm #youarewhatyoueateats

node.text:
➡️What is Bull's Blood?⁠
⁠
⁠
🔴Beet tops, or bull's blood, are exactly what they sound like—they're the leafy bits at the top of your beets.⁠
Beets (Beta vulgaris) are formally known as beetroots, as they are the taproots of (i.e. main/most dominant root) the beet plant.⁠
⁠
🔵They originate from the Mediterranean region, with a history reaching as far back as 2,000 B.C. Eventually, beets spread to Babylonia (modern Israel, Jordan, Syria, Iraq, and parts of Turkey, Saudi Arabia, Iran, and Egypt) around 700 A.D., and to China in 850 A.D.⁠
⁠
⚫Not only do they make your salads pop, but beets are also incredibly good for you. They contain an abundance of antioxidants, and have anti-inflammatory and detox properties. Rich in betaines, beets reduce your chances of developing heart diseases and stroke.⁠
⁠
⚪The lush greens are high in vitamin A and C, a great source of carotenoids, and flavonoid (which protects you from lung and oral cavity cancers)—exponentially more so than the beetroot itself.⁠
.
.
Was this useful information? Reply in comments with 👍 or 👎
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
Hey all it is Small Business Saturday!! Please consider our Xmas tree sale today in Waubeka ( Fredonia). 2021 we be our 14 th! Season offering Flower Bouquet Subscriptions. We offer a Spring bouquet subscription, Peony Bouquet Subscription, Every week or every other week subscription over a 18 week period. We also offer home delivery to Fredonia, Saukville, Grafton, Newburg, Cedarburg, South Cedar Grove, Belgium. You can find more info in our link to the webshop in our Bio. 
In additions to pre cut Balsam Trees we have locally produced produce, soaps and eggs at our stand. Buy a tree from us and know some of the profit goes toward the cost of registering our 1850 and -1880 buildings in Historical Registry. Have a beautiful weekend all!

node.text:
In Tunesien werden derzeit unsere Mandeln und Pistazien für den Transport vorbereitet und verpackt. Die Portionierung erfolgt hierbei direkt in große 1kg-Gebinde.
So werden zusätzliche Transportwege, Emissionen und Verpackungsabfall gespart. 67% unserer Produkte werden nie umgepackt. (Stand 2019)
Die tunesischen Mandeln und Pistazien kannst Du in unserem Shop bestellen. Link im Profil.
══════════════
In Tunisia, our almonds and pistachios are currently being packed and prepared for transport. They are directly being portioned into 1kg packages.
In this way, additional transport routes, emissions and packaging waste are being reduced. 67% of gebana products are never being repacked. (As of 2019)
________________________________
#WeltweitAbHof #gebana #PioneerOfChange #NatureIsQueen #organicalmonds #organicpistacios #beyondfairtrade #beyondorganic #chooseorganic #choosefairtrade #ethicalcompany #fairtradefoods #mehralsbio #nachhaltigerkonsum #bewusstleben #ökologisch #smallscalefarming #organicproduce #ethicalconsumption #reducewaste #reducefoodwaste #wertschöfpung #naturefirst #localproduce #eatseasonal #seasonalproduce #gemeinsambewegen #globalchange #activechange

node.text:
🐄B E R T' S  B A R R O W🐄⁠
⁠
Did you know we stock our delicious, real dairy ice cream at the lovely @berts_barrow farm shop? Bert's Barrow are located in Hillam, North Yorkshire and offer a great range of local produce😍⁠
⁠
They have plenty of stock in their farm shop, but you can also order online with their click & collect service. They have an amazing collection of Christmas trees on offer as well as great stocking filers! Head over to their account or take a look on their website (link in bio)⁠
⁠
Is Bert's Barrow a local for you? Why not take a visit and get your hands on the following Yorvale ice cream:⁠
🍦Vanilla with Vanilla Pod⁠
🍦Double Choc Chip⁠
🍦Mint Choc Chip⁠
🍦Strawberry Sensation⁠
🍦Sea Salted Caramel⁠
🍦Raspberry Cheesecake⁠
⁠
⁠
#yorvale #yorvaleicecream #yorkshireicecream #realdairyicecream #dairyicecream

node.text:
This week we have lettuce,  baby radish, green garlic and a choice of baby or full-size broad beans. The scapes are still on the garlic - you can cut them off and store them in the fridge or freezer for another day. Everything was in the garden this morning and is now sitting alongside a huge range of mouth-watering locally produced treats including @artezans_cakes cakes, @huonmecrumpets crumpets and @ourmatesfarm organic apple juice! 
20B Church St Geeveston, 10am-3pm Sat and Sun 
.
.

With the temps set to be extremely high not just today but tomorrow too. Please remember to take care of yourself. 

Sunscreen, a hat, sunglasses, take a lot of breaks, re apply sunscreen and drink a lot of water. Stay out of the sun in the heat of the day. 

Don’t end up like me!

node.text:
😊Yesterday we didn't get a chance to ask, What are you grateful for?
•
➡️For us, we are grateful for eachother and that our paths crossed at the right time in life. Grateful for our families love & support. Grateful for being alive and for the rough patches we experienced as individuals, because that helped shape us into who we are now. And grateful for creating On The Grow which has truly helped both of us grow and continues push us to expand into new areas of life that once scared us.
•
😁We've learned by experience that the things you fear will offer you the most growth, and we are extremely grateful for how everyone has come together in this community to help and learn with us.
.
.
.
#microgreens #greens #grow #microgreen #urbanfarmer #hydroponic #farmers #knowyourfarmer #localfarmers #indoorfarming #hydroponics #microfarm #horticulture #smallscalefarming #growlights #teach #plantscience #plantsmakepeoplehappy #microherbs #indoorplants #harvest #organic #soil #microgreens🌱 #microgreensfarm #chlorophyll #inspire

Such a wonderful day, all kicked off by my wonderful Tink who was an utter champion and carted all sorts of gubbins for @english_rancher And @andy.deane2 To finish the sheep fencing. This little pony never ceases to amaze me, no load too heavy, no amount of standing around is too long, and endless patience and energy. He’s put such a massive smile on my face all day long. Completely in love as you can tell from my face!
.
.
.

node.text:
Win one of two t-shirts by helping us with the design! We got this woodblock print of our logo made by Maine artist Iver Lofving for t-shirts. We just have no idea what colors people want. Here’s where you come in!

Comment in the post below what shirt/ink colors you would like to see. We will get the most suggested combo printed, and one of the people who suggested it selected at random will win that shirt. Because we don’t want people to just pile on the most popular colors, we will also award a t-shirt to one commenter selected at random who DIDN’T suggest the most popular combination. So let your t-shirt freak flag fly!

Ink colors are limited only by your imagination. Shirt colors include: lt green, dk green, black, yellow, red, coral pink, purple, lt blue, dk blue, beige, dk brown, natural, white and dark gray. We can’t wait to see what you come up with!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Growing For Market Magazine on November 27, 2020. Image may contain: text that says 'growing FOR MARKET'.

node.text:
4 days left to register for the Regenerative Earth Summit!⁠
⁠
We are so thrilled to have Cheryl Pinto, Global Values Led Sourcing Manager at @benandjerrys joining us for the Regenerative Earth Summit next week, December 1-2!⁠
⁠
As Ben & Jerry’s ‘Sorceress’, Cheryl works to advance positive social and environmental impact across all of Ben & Jerry’s value chains, from dairy and cocoa to chocolate fudge brownies. In 2018, Cheryl led Ben & Jerry’s efforts in becoming the first dairy company to adopt & implement the pioneering farmworker-led human-rights program, Milk with Dignity, within Ben & Jerry’s northeast dairy supply chain. Cheryl also launched and oversees Ben & Jerry’s Producer Development Initiative, which pursues dignified livelihoods for Fairtrade farmers, with a focus on advancing living income, climate resilience, and cooperative strengthening.⁠
⁠
Join Cheryl and many more #regenerativeleaders at the Regenerative Earth Summit! Link in bio to grab a ticket!⁠
⁠
#regenerativeagriculture #sustainableagriculture #smallscalefarming #groworganic #lovetheearth #foodsovereignty #soilhealth #naturaldye #medicinalplants #circularfashion #circulareconomy #slowfashion #regenerativefashion #knowwhomadeit #ecosystem #regenerativeearthsummit #regenerativebusiness ⁠

node.text:
Have you thought about heating your caterpillar tunnel? 

As the temperatures dip down, whether or not you can add a heater to a caterpillar tunnel is a question we are often asked. And the answer is YES!

This is a photo from Ray Tyler @rosecreekfarms after he recently installed a heater in one of his caterpillar tunnels. I chatted with Ray on some of the specifics, and this is what he shared. 

A 80,000 BTU Reznor heater (low profile) is the right size for a 14x100 Farmers Friend caterpillar tunnel with lift kit.

Ideally you also want 3 HAF (Horizontal Air Flow) fans to help circulate the heat throughout the tunnel.

Do you have any other questions? Have you installed a heater in your caterpillar tunnel? We'd love to hear your experience in the comments below. ⬇️
.
.
.
.
#caterpillartunnel #smallscalefarming #agriculture #farmsmall #knowyourfarmer #supportyourlocalfarmer #fourseasonfarming #marketfarming #marketgardening #organic #farm365 #farming #farmlife #smallfarms #foodsecurity #regenerativeag #sustainablesprout #profitablefarming #gardenguru #gardening #leanfarming #regenerativeagriculture #regenerativefarming #farmersfriend

node.text:
That time we bought a centennial farm. 🤗 Guys, I’m so excited for this next chapter.  Acre upon acre, there’s room to run, grow new life and host family and friends. This year has had a lot of highs and lows, and I’m thankful for God’s provisions through it all. 
 
#homesteading #homesteadersofmichigan #centennialfarm #michigancentennialfarm #permaculturefarm #michiganfarm #oldmadenew #acreage #smallscalefarming #northernmichiganfarming #zone5 #livestockfarming

node.accessibility_caption: Couple standing in front of their farm

node.text:
And just like that, we have a fence! Words can’t express the gratitude for something as simple as a barrier to keep deer from eating all of your veggies! We decided to go with a field fence, vs peanut butter on electric wire or motion detected sprinklers etc because this seemed like the most guaranteed method to keep the deer at bay. The fence is 8ft tall and if the deer jump over that just to eat our crops, somebody call the circus! 

This is one of the positive things that happened to us this year and it sets the tone for our next season and many seasons to come. Having a proper infrastructure to deal with outside pressure is a major necessity and a principle that we will take with us wherever we go! 

What are some positive things that happened to you this year? Let us know!🙌🏾🌱💯🦌✨
•
•
•
#growingfood #farming #regenerativeagriculture #smallscalefarming #gardening #notill #permaculture #regenerativefarming #blackfarmers #tallahassee #positivevibes #plants

node.text:
Have I told you how much we love this book?
On Sunday TFGCP releases our episode on Food Fix by @drmarkhyman
🌿
Learn about:

👉🏼How our government and policies are directly impacted by Big Food and Big Ag lobbyists
👉🏼The sneaky tactics used by the food Industry to hide harmful ingredients and chemicals in our food
👉🏼How our food system is the #1 cause of death in America
👉🏼How Regenerative Agriculture could help save the planet
👉🏼Choices you can make to protect your family and community

There’s so much great information packed into this book, if you’re still unsure about snagging a copy, listen to Sunday’s episode and get a better understanding of our food and agricultural system.
🐄🌿🐂🌱🐓

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Storm + Will in Rodale Institute with @drmarkhyman.

node.text:
How come Plant foods are just SO BEAUTIFUL?! I just adore them. 100% want to bring those into my body and let them become me ;)
(ok that sounded a little weird but you know what i mean ..!) 😆
.
Gorge produce this week from @nourishedcommunities – who, if you are local to #Islington, #London you’re lucky – these lovely peeps’ well-stocked popup shop open days are steadily increasing (think farm #marketstall + whole food shop + #zerowasteshop combined!)
.
I just love seeing small, passionate initiatives like these take foot and steadily grow stronger as people around them understand just how lucky they are to get access to this kind of produce. And just how much small businesses like these bring to a local area 👊 #shoplocalforthewin #londonlockdown2
.
Much love, Sara x
#shisodelicious

node.text:
This week we are happy to share with you @sullifarmandkitchen 👩‍🌾 They strive to build community around food, to have relationships with the families that consume their product.  They want you to know where your food comes from, how it was produced, how it affects you, and how it affects the environment around you. 💛

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @sullifarmandkitchen

“Here at Sullifarm, we embrace a rather full-circle scene in agriculture.  One that’s all about restoration, repair, healing and health.  We don’t just grow food, we strive to regenerate our soils and pastures in the process. 
.
Pasture-raising animals according to their natures thus creating the tastiest and healthiest food products in a local and regenerative farm setting.”

Hooks, TX
📸: @sullifarmandkitchen

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by 🍇Garden Community🍇 on November 26, 2020. Image may contain: outdoor.

node.text: We have been so busy getting the farm ready for winter but I’m happy to say we got the new greenhouse up and running right before the first snowfall of the season. It’s not perfect but I’m proud of how it came out and happy to have more space for our #microgreens 🌱Building a greenhouse from scratch was the easy part, growing in Tahoe during the winter will be the challenging part. 🌱🌱🌱 #HighAltitudeFarming
